rationale: States "one 1-gram tablet after breakfast each day until Sunday" but omits explicit Friday/Saturday wording and "last dose Sunday morning"/"5-day course" phrase.
Reason for visit notes "Rash burning at night, concern about medication duration"—captures both nighttime symptom and worry about needing more than five days.
Includes instruction to swallow with a full glass of water but omits mention of expected mild nausea/headache and clarification that no nighttime doses are required.
Records that Vitamin D chewable after lunch is safe and non-interactive; does not mention 1-hour spacing option.
No documentation of penicillin allergy concern or clinician reassurance.
Notes to continue medication if brand changes and inform staff, but omits guidance about one pill per blister slot, color/shape changes, and imprint verification.
Allergies not listed, so penicillin allergy not documented.
No fabricated conditions, drugs, or history appear in the note.
Valacyclovir dose strength and daily timing captured, but missing 5-day course detail and final morning timing; partial omission.
Captures most topics (rash, duration, dosing, vitamin D, pharmacy switch) but misses allergy discussion and side-effects.
No contradictions to transcript (no false cross-reactivity or stop advice).
